meanings.definition: A strict adherence to the basic principles of any subject or discipline.
meanings.sent1: His fundamentalism in mathematics made him excel in solving complex problems.
meanings.sent2: The fundamentalism of the team's training regimen led to their success in the competition.
meanings.sent3: The fundamentalism with which he followed the recipe resulted in a delicious meal.
meanings.sent4: Her fundamentalism in following traffic rules made her a safe driver.
meanings.sent5: The fundamentalism of the scientist's approach to research yielded groundbreaking discoveries.

meanings.definition: A movement or attitude stressing strict and literal adherence to a set of basic principles.
meanings.sent1: The rise of fundamentalism in the community brought about significant changes.
meanings.sent2: The fundamentalism of the political group alienated some of its members.
meanings.sent3: The fundamentalism with which he collected stamps amused his friends.
meanings.sent4: Her fundamentalism in organizing events made her the go-to person in the group.
meanings.sent5: The fundamentalism of his beliefs made him unwavering in the face of challenges.
